```js
    > Object.getOwnProperty
      Descriptor (Object.prototype,
      'toString');   
    Object   
    configurable: true   
    enumerable: false   
    value: function toString() {
     [native code] }   
    writable: true   

```

```js
    > var deadline = Object.freeze(   
        {date: "yesterday"});   
    > deadline.date = "tomorrow";   
    > deadline.excuse = "lame";   
 **> deadline.date;**
**"yesterday"**
**>
    deadline.excuse;**
**undefined**
**> 
    Object.isSealed(deadline);**
**true**

```

```js
 **>Object.prototype.customProto =
     101;**
 **> Object.getOwnPropertyNames(** 
 **Object.prototype);** 
 **["constructor", "toString", ...,
      "customProto"]** 
 **> Object.keys(Object.prototype);** 
 **["customProto"]**
**> var o = {own: 202};**
**> o.customProto;** 
**101**
**> Object.keys(o);**
**"own"]**

```

```js
    > var a = new Array(3.14); 
    Range Error: invalid array length 

```

```js
    > Object.prototype.toString
    .call
    ([]) === "[object Array]"; 
    true
    > Object.prototype.toString.call
    (arraylike) === 
    "[object Array]";
    false   

```

```js
    > var log =
    console.log.bind(console);   
    > var ar = ['itsy', 'bitsy',
      'spider'];   
    > ar.forEach(log);   
     itsy      0   ["itsy", 
     "bitsy", "spider"]   
     bitsy    1   ["itsy", 
     "bitsy", "spider"] 
     spider  2   ["itsy", 
    "bitsy", "spider"]   

```

```js
const arr = ['a', 'b', 'c'];
arr.fill(7)
[ 7, 7, 7 ]
You can specify start and end ranges.
['a', 'b', 'c'].fill(7, 1, 2)
[ 'a', 7, 'c' ]
```

```js
    > Math.random();   
    0.8279076443185321   
    For an random integer in a range,
     say between 10 and 100:   
    > Math.round(Math.random() * 90   + 10);   
    79   

```
